post.description: Creates a new live stream object and returns all the details required to access and broadcast the live stream. The API returns the Live stream object's ID, a stream URL and other details related to the live stream, which can be passed to your encoder and used to stream the video.

pulling_mode.description: Used to specify and enable/disable the RTMP url from where the live stream should be pulled.

enabled.description: Value of the parameter must be "true" to enable the given live stream.

url.description: RTMP url for the live stream.

enabled.description: Defines whether the live stream is currently enabled or disabled.

ingest.description: RTMP hostname and key for the live stream.

playback.description: Embeded url link and HLS url link for the live stream.

pulling_mode.description: Describes the RTMP url from where the live stream was pulled and specifies if the given stream is enabled or disabled.

environment.description: Environment where the live stream is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".

get.description: Returns the list of all available live streams in the Live API server.

enabled.description: Defines whether the live stream is active or not.

ingest.description: RTMP hostname and key for the live stream.

playback.description: Embeded url link and HLS url link for the live stream.

environment.description: Environment where the live stream is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".

get.description: Returns the details of a live stream using the unique live stream ID. The Live stream ID is provided to you when you first create the live stream.

enabled.description: Defines whether the live stream is active or not.

ingest.description: RTMP hostname and key for the live stream.

playback.description: Embeded url link and HLS url link for the live stream.

environment.description: Environment where the live stream is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".

patch.description: Updates the configuration of a live stream using the unique Live stream ID. The API allows you to change the settings of the live stream.

enabled.description: Value of the parameter must be "true" to enable the given live stream.
Defines whether the live stream is currently enabled or disabled.

ingest.description: RTMP hostname and key for the live stream.

playback.description: Embeded url link and HLS url link for the live stream.

pulling_mode.description: Describes the RTMP url from where the live stream was pulled and specifies if the given stream is enabled or disabled.

environment.description: Environment where the live stream is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".

delete.description: Deletes the Live stream using the given Live Stream ID. Upon deletion, all the information related to the given Live stream is removed from the LiveAPI server.

success.description: The value of this parameter is "true" if the video is successfully deleted.

get.description: Returns analytics data collected by the LiveAPI related to the consumption and performance of the given Live stream. The API uses the Live stream ID to fetch the analytics data of the given Live stream.

200.description: Fetch Live Stream Stats Success Response

post.summary: Create a multistream target of live
post.description: Creates a multistream object of the Live stream to broadcast the stream in multiple platforms. The API returns a multistream ID of the live stream which can be used to broadcast the stream in multiple platforms.

template.description: Template type used for the multistream target.

key.description: Stream Key. It is stream identifier on the third party live streaming service to send the parent live stream to.

enabled.description: Defines if the live stream is enabled or not.

id.description: Multistream ID returned by the API.

template.description: Template type used for the multistream target.

key.description: Stream Key. It is stream identifier on the third party live streaming service to send the parent live stream to.

enabled.description: Defines if the live stream is enabled or not.

patch.summary: Update a multistream target of live
patch.description: Updates the details of a multistream using the multistream ID.

template.description: Template type used for the multistream target.

key.description: Stream Key. It is stream identifier on the third party live streaming service to send the parent live stream to.

enabled.description: Defines if the live stream is enabled or not.

success.description: Defines if the reques to update the multistream is successful or not.

delete.summary: Delete a multistream target of live
delete.description: Deletes the existing multistream target of live using the multistream ID.

success.description: Defines if the reques to update the multistream is successful or not.

get.description: Fetch temporary recordings of the given live stream.

start_time.description: Stream start time in the UTC time format.

end_time.description: Stream end time in the UTC time format.

export_data.description: Array of objects including the details of each temporary video.

post.description: Convert the temporary recording in the given live stream to a VOD.

from.description: UTC timestamp of the video start time.

duration.description: Total duration of the video in seconds.

200.description: Convert Temporary Video to VOD Success Response

from.description: UTC timestamp of the video start time.

status.description: Current status of the video conversion.

get.description: Fetch the converted recordings in the given live stream.

playback.description: Embeded url link and HLS url link for the live stream.

environment.description: Environment where the live stream is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".

post.description: Creates a direct upload URL to upload video.

Create Direct Upload URL Success Response

enabled.description: Current enabled or disabled status of the video.

creation_time.description: Video creation time in the UTC format.

environment.description: Environment where the video is created. Value can be "Production" or "Development".
